page.title: 18 ******TOURISM*******
page.content: The canal which goes through the village is the Trent and Mersey.Lots of barges and canal boats make a stop on their journey at Willington for water intake or to visit one of the pubs or shops. Years ago the canal was used to transport fuels like coal,coke, peat and other manufactured goods across the country to ports or towns. Willington had storage wharves and a turning point for the long boats. Now the canal is solely used for pleasure boat cruises, holiday boating or 'on-board' boat parties. Beside the canal at Willington is a picnic area which, during the summer months,is used extensively by visitors to the village as a stopping point to break their journey near to the tranquillity of the now redundant canal.
